titlestmt.subtitle: Inventory of Records

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Paul E. Baran on March 18, 2013

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Waterbury, New Haven County, Town established in May 1686, City incorporated May 1853

The Waterbury Probate District was constituted May 1779, from the Woodbury Probate District. The Waterbury Probate District serves the municipalities of Waterbury, Middlebury, and Wolcott. It also served the municipality of Naugatcuk from May 1844 - July 3, 1863.
City of Waterbury, Probate District chronology:

May 1686 - October 1719, Hartford County Court & District
October 1719 - May 1779, Woodbury District
May 1779 - Present, Waterbury District
For Probate Court contact information and hours of operation see, .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Probate record books, None. Contact the probate court to access original record books. See Alternative Form Available note below.
Probate files, 1779-1945. Probate files may consist of estates, conservatorships, guardianships, commitments, and insolvencies. See Alternative Form Available note below.

Inventory control book, 1779-1945 (coverage). Also known as the Godard Digest, it is a list of probate files transferred to the Connecticut State Library. It was compiled at the Connecticut State Library under the direction of State Librarian George S. Godard.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Probate files in accession 1947-001 are arranged alphabetically.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aid
otherfindaid.p: Probate Files: The Probate Estate Papers Index, located in the index corridor adjacent to the History and Genealogy Reading Room, has two parts, a general index covering most of the state, and a Hartford Probate District index covering Hartford and some surrounding towns, 1820-1920. The index cards are arranged alphabetically by individual's last name and first names. The cards have the individual's name, town of residence, probate district, and list of items contained in the estate packet. To request retrieval of an estate packet, copy at least the estate name, file date, and probate district name from the index card. The probate files in Accession 1947-001 are represented in this index.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Researchers should first consult use copies when available. See Alternate Form Available Section below.

Probate files from 1921-1946 are RESTRICTED as they may contain confidential documents. Tax returns (succession, transfer and estate tax returns and all attachments) from January 1, 1921 and later are confidential per Connecticut General Statutes §12-15. Adoptions (all documents) from January 1, 1944 and later are confidential per Connecticut General Statutes §45a-754. Contact State Archives staff for assistance.

altformavail.head: Alternative Form Available
altformavail.p: Record books, volumes 1-134*, 1779-1916, probate files, 1779-1880; and inventory control book (Godard Digest) were microfilmed by the Genealogical Society of Utah and are available for use in the History and Genealogy reading room or through the .

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The probate files in accession 1947-001 were transferred to the Connecticut State Library on the following dates (with date span of files): October 7, 1947 (1779-1845).

note.p: Index of the four accessions of probate files now merged into accession 1947-001
Also known as the Godard Digest
